intro: Dicliptera rigidissima, commonly known as the rigid thornsteppe, is a perennial grass species native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its stiff, erect growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters, typical of the Poaceae family. It is well adapted to drought conditions, with deep root systems that help it survive in poor soil. Dicliptera rigidissima plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for wildlife in its native habitat.
